content:
I can not speak for the intentions of individual authors. still, it is safe to say that most writers use the landscape to convey specific themes and emotions intentionally. many writers use the landscape as a metaphor or to reinforce the story's themes throughout the narrative. the landscape allows the characters' environment to convey something about their inner lives and their struggles.

on the other hand, some writers might come up with the landscape first and build the story around it. for example, an author may visit or be inspired by a particular landscape so much that it becomes a central component of the story they want to write. however, this approach is not always the case, and many writers may develop their landscape as the narrative progresses.

regardless, the landscape is an essential element of many stories, and the way it is depicted can have a significant impact on the story's themes and characterization.
